What I Use

Here's a rundown of the tools I use in my everyday development.

  • Code editor: VS Code
  • Accessibility Testing: WAVE
  • Accessibility Testing: axe
  • Accessibility Testing: ARC Toolkit
  • Accessibility Testing: IBM Equal Access Checker
  • Accessibility Testing: Paul J. Adam Bookmarklets
  • Accessibility Testing: Ian Lloyd Bookmarklets
  • Accessibility Testing: Adrian Roselli 24x24px Cursor Bookmarklet
  • Accessibility Testing: ANDI Accessibility Testing Tool
  • Accessibility Testing: AccessiBe Gone
  • Accessibility Testing: Accessibility Insights
  • Accessibility Testing: Tota11y 2
  • Accessibility Testing: Access Lint
  • Accessibility Testing: Nu HTML Checker Bookmarklet
  • Accessibility Testing: aria-owns Bookmarklet
  • Accessibility Testing: Firefox DevTools Accessibility Inspector
  • Accessibility Testing: Assistiv Labs
  • Accessibility Testing: NVDA Screen Reader
  • Accessibility Testing: Text Spacing bookmarklet
  • Hosting: Netlify
  • Code Repo: GitHub
  • Browser: Firefox
  • Email: Protonmail
  • Terminal: iTerm2
  • Video Meetings: Zoom
  • Organization: Notion
  • Collaboration Boards: Trello
  • Photo Editing: Affinity Photo
  • Vector Work: Affinity Designer
  • Music: Deezer
  • Design: Figma
  • Writing: Ulysses
  • Notes: Drafts
  • Emoji App: Rocket
  • Clipboard Manager: Flycut
